page.title: 06Ecclesiastical Boundary
page.content: An unusual boundary situation exists in that, whereas the civil parish of Eaton Bishop is now bounded on the north by the River Wye, the ecclesiastical parish of that name extends across the river to include an area on the north side. (The civil parish used to do so too.) Thus it is necessary for parishioners on that side to cross the river to reach Eaton Bishop parish church. This arrangement was facilitated in earlier days by the existence of a ferry, now discontinued, which plied across the river. Nowadays, the river crossing, though easier by car, involves a detour of about eight miles to cross by the nearest bridge westwards, at Bridge Sollers.
